page.title: 12FORRES SCOTTISH WEEK 85
page.content: Every three years in the month of June Forres Community Activities Association holds a Scottish Week.The organisers have endeavoured to provide activities for all sections of the community of Forres and district with the emphasis on enjoyment and fun.Scottish Week consists of many traditional events with a Scottish flavour such as crowning the queen and rydeing of the marches.This involes people including members of the Disabled riding club,riding their horses round the old boundaries of the town.Some newer events include a BMX(Bicycle Moto Cross) competition for bikers and a Gala Disco(Dance) at a local hotel. The finale to Scottish Week '85 will be Beating the Retreat at the Market Cross,by a champion Pipe Band.
